availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles H. Cox (Carroll County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Carroll County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Jane Furnish Cox in Carroll County, Kentucky, on June 12, 1845. Father of Miriam G. Cox, Sarah Isabel Cox, Eliza J. Cox, John J. Cox, Candace Cox, Charles W. Cox, and Robert Cox. Farmer in Carroll County in 1850. Farmer in Carroll County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 1, pp. 180A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Ghent, p. 97.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Carrollton, p. 1B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Ghent.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carroll County Marriages, Film #000414689, p. 133.
Find A Grave, "Charles H. Cox (1819-1900)," Memorial #117599989, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117599989 (accessed May 19, 2020).
